meanings.definition: Capable of being proven wrong or false.
meanings.sent1: The scientist presented refutable evidence to challenge the theory.
meanings.sent2: It is important to consider refutable arguments when making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The refutable claim that cats can fly made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like a refutable castle, easily dismantled by facts.
meanings.sent5: The refutable nature of the statement was evident to all.

meanings.definition: Able to be contradicted or disproved.
meanings.sent1: The refutable theory was quickly debunked by experts.
meanings.sent2: His refutable explanation did not convince the audience.
meanings.sent3: The refutable excuse for being late was quite creative.
meanings.sent4: The refutable argument crumbled under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The refutable nature of the claim was evident from the start.
